proscene
Class PSInteractiveFrame

java.lang.Object
  proscene.PSFrame
      proscene.PSInteractiveFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, PSMouseGrabber
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSInteractiveCameraFrame
public class PSInteractiveFrame
extends PSFrame
implements PSMouseGrabber, java.lang.Cloneable

A PSInteractiveFrame is a PSFrame that can be rotated and translated using the mouse.

It converts the mouse motion into a translation and an orientation updates. A PSInteractiveFrame is used to move an object in the scene. Combined with object selection, its PSMouseGrabber properties and a dynamic update of the scene, the PSInteractiveFrame introduces a great reactivity in your processing applications.

Nested Class Summary
static class PSInteractiveFrame.CoordinateSystemConvention
          This enum defines the coordinate system convention which is defined as LEFT_HANDED by default (processing standard).

Constructor Detail

PSInteractiveFrame

public PSInteractiveFrame()
Default constructor.

The PSFrame.translation() is set to (0,0,0), with an identity PSFrame.rotation() (0,0,0,1) (see PSFrame constructor for details). The different sensitivities are set to their default values (see rotationSensitivity() , translationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity() and wheelSensitivity()).

clone

public PSInteractiveFrame clone()
Implementation of the clone method.

Calls PSFrame.clone() and makes a deep copy of the remaining object attributes except for prevConstraint (which is shallow copied).

checkIfGrabsMouse

public void checkIfGrabsMouse(int x,
                              int y,
                              PSCamera camera)
Implementation of the PSMouseGrabber main method.

The PSInteractiveFrame grabsMouse() when the mouse is within a 10 pixels region around its PSCamera.projectedCoordinatesOf(PVector) PSFrame.position().

Specified by:
checkIfGrabsMouse in interface PSMouseGrabber

grabsMouse

public boolean grabsMouse()
Returns true when the PSMouseGrabber grabs the PScene's mouse events.

This flag is set with setGrabsMouse(boolean) by the checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, PSCamera) method.

Specified by:
grabsMouse in interface PSMouseGrabber

setGrabsMouse

public void setGrabsMouse(boolean grabs)
Sets the grabsMouse() flag. Normally used by checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, PSCamera).

Specified by:
setGrabsMouse in interface PSMouseGrabber

isInMouseGrabberPool

public boolean isInMouseGrabberPool()
Returns true if the PSMouseGrabber is currently in the mouseGrabberPool() list.

Default value is true. When set to false using removeFromMouseGrabberPool(), the PScene no longer checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, PSCamera) on this PSMouseGrabber. Use addInMouseGrabberPool() to insert it back.

Specified by:
isInMouseGrabberPool in interface PSMouseGrabber

addInMouseGrabberPool

public void addInMouseGrabberPool()
Adds the PSMouseGrabber in the mouseGrabberPool().

All created PSMouseGrabber are automatically added in the mouseGrabberPool() by the constructor. Trying to add a PSMouseGrabber that already isInMouseGrabberPool() has no effect.

Use removeFromMouseGrabberPool() to remove the PSMouseGrabber from the list, so that it is no longer tested with checkIfGrabsMouse(int, int, PSCamera) by the PScene, and hence can no longer grab mouse focus. Use isInMouseGrabberPool() to know the current state of the PSMouseGrabber.

Specified by:
addInMouseGrabberPool in interface PSMouseGrabber

removeFromMouseGrabberPool

public void removeFromMouseGrabberPool()
Removes the PSMouseGrabber from the mouseGrabberPool().

See addInMouseGrabberPool() for details. Removing a PSMouseGrabber that is not in mouseGrabberPool() has no effect.

Specified by:
removeFromMouseGrabberPool in interface PSMouseGrabber

clearMouseGrabberPool

public void clearMouseGrabberPool()
Clears the mouseGrabberPool().

Use this method only if it is faster to clear the mouseGrabberPool() and then to add back a few PSMouseGrabbers than to remove each one independently. Use PScene.setMouseTracking(false) instead if you want to disable mouse grabbing.

Specified by:
clearMouseGrabberPool in interface PSMouseGrabber

public final void setWheelSensitivity(float sensitivity)
Defines the wheelSensitivity().

rotationSensitivity

public final float rotationSensitivity()
Returns the influence of a mouse displacement on the PSInteractiveFrame rotation.

Default value is 8.0. With an identical mouse displacement, a higher value will generate a larger rotation (and inversely for lower values). A 0.0 value will forbid PSInteractiveFrame mouse rotation (see also PSFrame.constraint()).

See Also:
setRotationSensitivity(float), translationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

translationSensitivity

public final float translationSensitivity()
Returns the influence of a mouse displacement on the PSInteractiveFrame translation.

Default value is 1.0. You should not have to modify this value, since with 1.0 the PSInteractiveFrame precisely stays under the mouse cursor.

With an identical mouse displacement, a higher value will generate a larger translation (and inversely for lower values). A 0.0 value will forbid PSInteractiveFrame mouse translation (see also PSFrame.constraint()).

Note: When the PSInteractiveFrame is used to move a Camera (see the PSInteractiveCameraFrame class documentation), after zooming on a small region of your scene, the camera may translate too fast. For a camera, it is the PSCamera.revolveAroundPoint() that exactly matches the mouse displacement. Hence, instead of changing the translationSensitivity(), solve the problem by (temporarily) setting the PSCamera.revolveAroundPoint() to a point on the zoomed region).

See Also:
setTranslationSensitivity(float), rotationSensitivity(), spinningSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

spinningSensitivity

public final float spinningSensitivity()
Returns the minimum mouse speed required (at button release) to make the PSInteractiveFrame spin().

See spin(), spinningQuaternion() and startSpinning(int) for details.

Mouse speed is expressed in pixels per milliseconds. Default value is 0.3 (300 pixels per second). Use setSpinningSensitivity() to tune this value. A higher value will make spinning more difficult (a value of 100.0 forbids spinning in practice).

See Also:
setSpinningSensitivity(float), translationSensitivity(), rotationSensitivity(), wheelSensitivity()

isSpinning

public final boolean isSpinning()
Returns true when the PSInteractiveFrame is spinning.

During spinning, spin() rotates the PSInteractiveFrame by its spinningQuaternion() at a frequency defined when the PSInteractiveFrame startSpinning(int).

Use startSpinning(int) and stopSpinning() to change this state. Default value is false.

spinningQuaternion

public final PSQuaternion spinningQuaternion()
Returns the incremental rotation that is applied by spin() to the PSInteractiveFrame orientation when it isSpinning().

Default value is a null rotation (identity PSQuaternion). Use setSpinningQuaternion(PSQuaternion) to change this value.

The spinningQuaternion() axis is defined in the PSInteractiveFrame coordinate system. You can use PSFrame.transformOfFrom(PVector, PSFrame) to convert this axis from an other PSFrame coordinate system.

setSpinningQuaternion

public final void setSpinningQuaternion(PSQuaternion spinningQuaternion)
Defines the spinningQuaternion(). Its axis is defined in the PSInteractiveFrame coordinate system.

stopSpinning

public final void stopSpinning()
Stops the spinning motion started using startSpinning(int). isSpinning() will return false after this call.

startSpinning

public void startSpinning(int updateInterval)
Starts the spinning of the PSInteractiveFrame.

This method starts a timer that will call spin() every updateInterval milliseconds. The PSInteractiveFrame isSpinning() until you call stopSpinning().

spin

public void spin()
Rotates the PSInteractiveFrame by its spinningQuaternion(). Called by a timer when the PSInteractiveFrame isSpinning().

mousePressEvent

public void mousePressEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
                            PSCamera camera)
Initiates the PSInteractiveFrame mouse manipulation. Overloading of PSMouseGrabber.mousePressEvent(MouseEvent, PSCamera). The mouse behavior depends on which button is pressed.

Specified by:
mousePressEvent in interface PSMouseGrabber
See Also:
mouseMoveEvent(MouseEvent, PSCamera), mouseReleaseEvent(MouseEvent, PSCamera)

mouseMoveEvent

public void mouseMoveEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
                           PSCamera camera)
Modifies the PSInteractiveFrame according to the mouse motion.

Actual behavior depends on mouse bindings. See the PScene documentation for details.

The camera is used to fit the mouse motion with the display parameters.

Specified by:
mouseMoveEvent in interface PSMouseGrabber
See Also:
PSCamera.screenWidth(), PSCamera.screenHeight(), PSCamera.fieldOfView()

mouseReleaseEvent

public void mouseReleaseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
                              PSCamera camera)
Stops the PSInteractiveFrame mouse manipulation.

Overloading of PSMouseGrabber.mouseReleaseEvent(MouseEvent, PSCamera).

If the action was ROTATE MouseAction, a continuous spinning is possible if the speed of the mouse cursor is larger than spinningSensitivity() when the button is released. Press the rotate button again to stop spinning.

Specified by:
mouseReleaseEvent in interface PSMouseGrabber
See Also:
startSpinning(int), isSpinning()

mouseDoubleClickEvent

public void mouseDoubleClickEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent event,
                                  PSCamera camera)
Overloading of PSMouseGrabber.mouseDoubleClickEvent(MouseEvent, PSCamera).

Left button double click aligns the PSInteractiveFrame with the camera axis (see PSFrame.alignWithFrame(PSFrame)). Right button projects the PSInteractiveFrame on the camera view direction.

Specified by:
mouseDoubleClickEvent in interface PSMouseGrabber

mouseWheelEvent

public void mouseWheelEvent(java.awt.event.MouseWheelEvent event,
                            PSCamera camera)
Overloading of PSMouseGrabber.mouseWheelEvent(MouseWheelEvent, PSCamera).

Using the wheel is equivalent to a ZOOM MouseAction.

Specified by:
mouseWheelEvent in interface PSMouseGrabber
See Also:
setWheelSensitivity(float)
